Fluffy Paleo Blueberry Pancakes

Jump to Recipe

Delicious paleo blueberry pancakes made extra fluffy with simple, healthy ingredients all made in one bowl! The perfect weekend breakfast or brunch recipe packed with refreshing blueberry flavors, no added sugars and 100% dairy-free + gluten-free! Thank you to Bob’s Red Mill for sponsoring this post and supporting the brands that make TNK possible.

I feel like there are two types of people in the world: team pancakes or team waffles…which category do you fall under? Pancakes are my personal love language, specifically extra fluffy, naturally sweetened stacks of blueberry pancakes that make you feel waves of nostalgia. Maybe it’s growing up with weekend pancakes after a slumber party or a new Sunday morning pancake ritual you started. They just hit different you know?

These paleo blueberry pancakes are by far my new favorite weekend treat after a slow Sunday run or weekday “brinner”. They’re full of fresh, vibrant flavors of Spring and pair perfectly with an iced coffee in bed. Heaven!

Why you’ll love these paleo blueberry pancakes

I could list 100 reasons why these homemade blueberry pancakes will be your new go-to recipe but here are a few:

100% paleo & natural ingredients

Easy to make in one bowl!

Extra fluffy + moist texture!

Full of fresh blueberry maple flavors

Gluten-free, grain-free and dairy-free!

Ingredients you’ll need

  • Bob’s Red Mill Super-Fine Almond Flour: Most of the flour base will be Almond Flour which is one of my favorite grain-free alternatives for getting a moist, cake-like texture! Make sure to get the “super fine flour” like this one and not almond meal. Bob’s Red Mill is always my go-to as you know 🙂
  • Tapioca Flour: This helps create a light and fluffy texture to the pancakes. You can also try Arrowroot starch/flour or substitute oat flour. I’ve tested both!
  • 1 Egg: I haven’t tested a vegan version but I’m sure a flax egg will work!
  • Unsweetened Apple Sauce: Not only does this add a natural touch of sweetness, but it helps create a deliciously moist texture to the pancakes.
  • Cashew Butter: I love the addition of cashew butter for the flavor and cakey dense texture it creates. I don’t recommend any substitutes!
  • Cinnamon & sea salt
  • Fresh Blueberries: For a classic pancake mix-in of course 🙂 But feel free to swap out for chocolate chips if you’re craving that!

For extra flavor…

  • Maple Syrup: Maple syrup is the goddess of all pancake toppings. Especially since the pancakes themselves require zero added sugar, this adds a nice sweetness 🙂
  • Ghee or Vegan Butter: This is to grease the pan so the pancakes don’t stick and get a nice buttery crisp flavor on the outside. Feel free to sub coconut oil but I prefer plant-based butter for flavor!
  • Lemon Zest: For ultimate spring flavors, I love adding lemon zest into the batter and on top!

What makes these pancakes so fluffy and thick?

So what makes them so fluffy? To be honest it has taken me a while to create the best paleo version of thick pancake stacks. The two secret ingredients in these paleo blueberry pancakes happen to be almond flour and tapioca flour! Of course, I used my favorite Bob’s Red Mill brand which is always my go-to for quality, nutrient-dense baking flours. The tapioca flour adds an extra element of thickness while the almond flour keeps them moist and cakey. This is the ideal combo for achieving fluffy pancakes without drying them out!

Tips and tools for making perfectly round pancakes

Heat the pan with butter first: It’s important to grease your pan with coconut oil or ghee/butter over medium heat before adding pancake batter. I like to allow a minute or so to allow the oil to get hot. This pan is my current favorite for pancakes.

Cook slowly on lower heat: In order to ensure the pancakes get cooked all the way through, it’s important to cook on medium / medium-low heat. This prevents the pancakes from getting overcooked on the outside and undercooked on the inside.

Use a cookie scooper: You don’t need a fancy pancake maker to get perfectly round cakes! I usually use a cookie scoop like this one from amazon to form thick medium-sized pancakes.

Add blueberries while on the pan: Instead of mixing your blueberries into the batter I recommend waiting until you form them onto the pan. Once you’ve scooped your pancake batter onto the pan, place some blueberries into the cakes. After a few minutes, you’ll flip and wala! Perfect blueberry to pancake ratio!

Topping ideas for blueberry pancakes

Extra blueberries or sliced bananas

Fresh lemon zest

Maple syrup or raw honey

Tahini + maple syrup drizzle

Nut Butter of choice

Chopped pecans, almonds or walnuts

More gluten-free breakfast ideas to check out

Easy Blender Banana Pancakes

Paleo Zucchini Coffee Cake Loaf

Bakery Style Lemon Blueberry Muffins

Print

Fluffy Paleo Blueberry Pancakes

Print Recipe
Pin Recipe

★★★★★

5 from 1 reviews

Delicious paleo blueberry pancakes made extra fluffy with simple, healthy ingredients all made in one bowl! The perfect weekend breakfast or brunch recipe packed with refreshing blueberry flavors, no added sugars and 100% dairy-free + gluten-free!

  • Author: Selena Sharpless
  • Prep Time: 5
  • Cook Time: 15
  • Total Time: 20 minutes
  • Yield: 6–8 pancakes 1x
  • Category: breakfast
  • Method: stove top
  • Cuisine: pancakes
  • Diet: Gluten Free

Ingredients

Scale
  • 3/4 cup unsweetened apple sauce
  • 1/4 cup cashew butter
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 cup Bobs Red Mill super fine almond flour
  • 1 cup tapioca flour, or arrowroot flour
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • Sea salt + cinnamon to taste
  • 1/3 cup fresh blueberries

For topping

  • Pure maple syrup
  • Coconut cream (optional)
  • Vegan butter or ghee

Instructions

  1. In a large bowl whisk the apple sauce, cashew butter and egg until fully combined.
  2. Then add in the almond flour, tapioca flour, baking powder, sea salt, and cinnamon. Combine with a mixing spoon until a thick batter forms. It will be thick but still moist!
  3. Heat ghee or butter in a pan over medium heat. Once the pan is hot, scoop the batter using a cookie scoop or about 1/4 cup full of batter. I like to cook 3 at a time.
  4. Place some blueberries onto the pancakes while on pan and cook for about 3 minutes. Flip gently, and continue cooking for about 2 minutes over medium-low heat.
  5. Repeat with remaining batter then serve with maple syrup, extra butter and toppings of choice. I love coconut cream or cashew butter!

Keywords: paleo, pancakes, gluten-free, dairy-free

Did you make this recipe?
